notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform release 4.8.34 is now available with
updates to packages and images that fix several bugs.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

This advisory contains the RPM packages for Red Hat OpenShift Container
Platform 4.8.34. See the following advisory for the container images for
this release:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2022:0795

All OpenShift Container Platform 4.8 users are advised to upgrade to these
updated packages and images when they are available in the appropriate
release channel. To check for available updates, use the OpenShift Console
or the CLI oc command. Instructions for upgrading a cluster are available
at
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/updating/updating-cluster-cli.html
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 4.8.34 packages update

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: An incorrect sysctls validation vulnerability was found in CRI-O. The sysctls from the list of "safe" sysctls specified for the cluster [0] will be applied to the host if an attacker can create a pod with a `hostIPC` and `hostNetwork` kernel namespace.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: pod with access to 'hostIPC' and 'hostNetwork' kernel namespace allows sysctl from the list of safe sysctls to be applied to the host
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#2051730: pod with access to 'hostIPC' and 'hostNetwork' kernel namespace allows sysctl from the list of safe sysctls to be applied to the host

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.8 see the following documentation, which
will be updated shortly for this release, for important instructions on how
to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/release_notes/ocp-4-8-release-notes.html

Details on how to access this content are available at
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/updating/updating-cluster-cli.html

vulnerabilities.title: pod with access to 'hostIPC' and 'hostNetwork' kernel namespace allows sysctl from the list of safe sysctls to be applied to the host
